column4: 4.) There are no Cancel or Restore Defaults  buttons in many places. So, I can't change my mind?
> No one can answer my questions? <
>>> I see no one answers my questions. I'll paste them soon to pastebin, and link it. <<<

here are my questions: 1. Even if I change language, the login screen and the software center's some parts remain the old language. 2. If I try to change Digital Vibrance or Image Sharpening in NVIDIA X Server Settings, it quits immediately. 3.) Can I change the password dots to be smaller? It was bigger with other Linux distributions, like Mandriva, too. 4.) There are no Cancel or Restore Defaults  buttons in many plac
this means that you chosen language is not fully translated yet..
regarding "changing password dot size", I also having no idea yet, I'm also a beginner too..
then select english of your country.. then click APPLY SYSTEM WIDE button
okay i've already discovered I need to press that button
for sure, restart your machine after that
no, software center remained hungarian. to be exact, only app names and descriptions.
System -> Administration -> Language Support -> Text -> english -> apply system wide
That's what I did already!!! Even restarted after that.
check there are two tabs in Language and Text window viz. "Language" and "Text"... in both had you done that?
do that in both.. restart and tell results back
